titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Hiram Larew literary papers, 1947-2018 MS2225
titlestmt.author: Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University

publicationstmt.publisher: Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-01-11 11:42:25 -0500.

repository.corpname: Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University

did.abstract: This collection contains correspondence, contact lists, notebooks, journals, working files, manuscripts, poems, drafts, pictures and drawings, professional journals, magazines, serials, chapbooks, promotional materials, clippings, maps, brochures, schedules, workshop presentations and plans, CD's, DVDs, cassette tapes, VHS tapes and photographs pertaining to the works and poetry career of poet Hiram Larew. The materials date from 1947-2019, with the bulk of the materials dated from 1967-2019.
did.physloc: Materials are stored off-site, and will require additional retrieval time. Please contact the Special Collections Research Center for more information.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for use.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into seven series: Correspondence and contacts, Writings and drafts, Published works, Promotional materials and events, Workshops and conferences, Audiovisual materials, Photographs.

bioghist.head: Historical or Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Hiram Larew (1953-) is an award winning poet based in the Washington, DC area, and an advocate for diverse voices in poetry. Born in 1953, Hiram Larew received his batchelor's degree from the University of Georgia and both a master's and PhD degrees from Oregon State University. In addition to his successful life as a poet, Larew enjoyed a distinguished career as an agricultual scientist and the Director of International Programs for the National Institute for Food and Agriculture at the U.S. Department of Agriculture before retiring in 2015.

Larew has published his poetry in many journals, books and collections and has received four Pushcart nominations and awards from Louisiana Literature, the washington review and others. His first collection of poems was published in 1999 by the City of Baltimore as the winning entry in the Artscape poetry competition. His second collection, "More Than Anything", was published in 2007 by Vrzhu Press. His third collection of poems, "Utmost", was published in 2016 by I. Giraffe Press.

He co-founded The Poet Connection, an informal advocacy effort that promotes the diversity of poetic voices in Prince George's County and is active in organizing and participating in poetry events that feature diverse voices. He has been involved in many poetry conferences and workshops including the Bread Loaf Writers' Workshop and the Catskills Poetry Conference. Mr. Larew is a member of the Folger Shakespeare Library Poetry Board. He lives in Upper Marlboro, MD.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Please cite unpublished materials in the following way:

Please provide the title and date of item, catalog number (if applicable it will be found written on the folder), name of the collection, name of the repository, and location of the repository. Example: James Oglethorpe to the Trustees, 13 January 1876, RG0001 Series 1, Box 4, Folder 3. Records of the Board of Trustees, Special Collections Research Center, Gelman Library, The George Washington University, Washington, D.C.

scopecontent.head: Collection Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection contains correspondence, contact lists, notebooks, journals, working files, manuscripts, poems, drafts, pictures and drawings, professional journals, magazines, serials, chapbooks, promotional materials, clippings, maps, brochures, schedules, workshop presentations and plans, CD's, DVDs, cassette tapes, VHS tapes, photographs and books. The materials date from 1947-2019, with the bulk of the materials dated from 1967-2019. The records document poet Hiram Larew's creative process, works and poetry career, and also include materials by and about other poets that Hiram Larew collected.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: Poetry books that have been separated and added to the Special Collections stacks all have a note that reads "Gift of Hiram Larew" Those can be found using the Library's online catalog.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Some material may be copyrighted or restricted. It is the patron's obligation to determine and satisfy copyright or other case restrictions when publishing or otherwise distributing materials found in the collections

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Series is arranged chronologically. Undated folders are at the end of the series.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials in this series include contact lists, address books, letters, e-mails, postcards, greeting cards, submissions, contracts and other legal documents, press releases, flyers, clippings, photographs, and works by other authors and poets. The materials range in date from 1984 to 2019. This series contains professional contact lists and correspondence produced and received by Hiram Larew dealing with poetry submissions, published works, readings, awards, the editorial process, publicity and promotional efforts, and general correspondence.

did.unittitle: Correspondence: Clippings, Readings, Awards, Published Works
Correspondence: Clippings, Posters, Readings, Published Works

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Series is arranged alphabetically by title or subject.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains materials documenting the creative process of Hiram Larew's published and unpublished works. It also includes published and unpublished writings, poems and essays by other authors collected by Hiram Larew. The materials range in date from 1967 to 2018, but much of the material in this series is undated. Materials in this series include edited poems, personal journals, notebooks, drafts, galleys, printouts, school assignments, drawings, correspondence, promotional materials, essays, poems, writings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains poems written by Hiram Larew and published in journals, anthologies, newspapers, magazines, and newsletters. It also includes a booklet of poems created for the Martin Luther King Memorial Celebration event of January 15, 2000, and distributed to all event attendees. The materials range in date from 1976 to 2019. Materials in this series include professional journals, magazines, anthologies, newspapers, newsletters, and booklets.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains promotional materials, correspondence, and planning materials for poetry readings and other events that Hiram Larew participated in to publicize his work or that he organized, and for personal publicity. Also included are promotional materials of readings, events, and personal publicity featuring other poets that Hiram Larew collected and/or attended. The materials range in date from 1986 to 2019. Materials in this series include correspondence, planning documents, flyers, press releases, program booklets, brochures, news clippings, articles, personal calendars, postcards, newsletters, maps, and photographs.

did.unittitle: Davies annual poetry and music service
Pan and Pen a fusion of new music + verse
Prince George's County Poet Laureate legislation
St. Mary's Festival of Poets and Poetry
Strengthening our communities through poetry and paintings

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains materials related to workshops and conferences that Hiram Larew attended as a participant, lecturer, or speaker. The materials range in date from 2001 to 2019. Materials in this series include correspondence, brochures, handouts, schedules, planning, presentation, and preparation documents, speeches, edited and annotated poems and other writings in progress.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Series is arranged alphabetically by title or subject.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains CDs, DVDs, VHS tapes and cassette tapes of poetry readings, performances, and works by Hiram Larew and other poets. The materials range in date from 1992 to 2016. There is a video recording of the Allen Ginsburg Poetry Awards Ceremony. Also of note is a video recording of the Poet Connection, an advocacy group that promotes diverse voices in poetry which Larew co-founded.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains photographs of Hiram Larew and other poets, many from the Washington, DC area. Most of the photographs are candid shots. The materials range in date from 1947-2007, with the bulk of the materials dated from 2000-2007.
